Package entities

Class HorseJockey

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • entities.HorseJockey

  • public class HorseJockey
extends java.lang.Thread
    Implementation of a pair Horse/Jockey, the main horse race character. This entity, belonging to the entities package, represents one of N pairs in a competition, being the bets target (by the Spectator) and having its conduct coordinated by the Broker.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes
    See Also:
    Broker, Spectator

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Field Detail

      • state

        private HorseJockeyState state
        A representation of the pair Horse/Jockey's state given by the HorseJockeyState enumeration.

      • identification

        private int identification
        Proper pair Horse/Jockey identification number.

      • ability

        private int ability
        Pair Horse/Jockey ability to run. This value represents how easily this pair Horse/Jockey can advance on its track of the Racing Track.

      • raceNumber

        private int raceNumber
        Pair Horse/Jockey race identification number. This number identifies which race they are going to compete. This value can be updated via its setter method setRaceNumber(int).

      • controlCentre

        private ControlCentre controlCentre
        The ControlCentre instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.

      • paddock

        private Paddock paddock
        The Paddock instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.

      • racingTrack

        private RacingTrack racingTrack
        The RacingTrack instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.

      • stable

        private Stable stable
        The Stable instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HorseJockey

        public HorseJockey​(int identification,
                   int ability,
                   ControlCentre controlCentre,
                   Paddock paddock,
                   RacingTrack racingTrack,
                   Stable stable)
        Creates a pair Horse/Jockey with a given identification and an ability to run.
        Parameters:
        identification - number which identifies this pair Horse/Jockey.
        ability - number with characterizes the Horse ability to run.
        controlCentre - the ControlCentre instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.
        paddock - the Paddock instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.
        racingTrack - the RacingTrack instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.
        stable - the Stable instance where this pair Horse/Jockey (HorseJockey) will perform its actions.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run​()
        Definition of the HorseJockey's lifecycle. In a technical perspective this is reasoned by a thread definition function which resumes all the specifications of a HorseJockey pair, since its displacement from the Paddock, to the Stable, passing by the RacingTrack.
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • getHorseJockeyState

        public HorseJockeyState getHorseJockeyState​()
        Returns the pair Horse/Jockey state representation given by the HorseJockeyState enumeration.
        Returns:
        the current spectator HorseJockeyState.
        See Also:
        HorseJockeyState

      • setHorseJockeyState

        public void setHorseJockeyState​(HorseJockeyState state)
        Sets the HorseJockey's state, from the possible available HorseJockeyState enumeration.
        Parameters:
        state - Enumeration value represented by HorseJockeyState

      • getIdentification

        public int getIdentification​()
        Returns the pair Horse/Jockey number identification.
        Returns:
        a number represented by an integer.

      • getAbility

        public int getAbility​()
        Returns the pair Horse/Jockey ability to move forward on its track of the Racing Track.
        Returns:
        an integer representation of the ability.

      • getRaceNumber

        public int getRaceNumber​()
        Returns the pair Horse/Jockey race number identification, in order to compete in the Racing Track.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the identification.

      • setRaceNumber

        public void setRaceNumber​(int raceNumber)
        Sets a new race number identification for this pair Horse/Jockey, appliable when this same entity runs in different occasions.
        Parameters:
        raceNumber - an integer representing the identification.
